description.narrative: IFC proposes an investment of up to 10 million in Rural Investment Fund II (RIF II), representing up to 20% of the total equity of a global fund- a 10 year hybrid fund. The fund size is 100 million, financed with share capital from a number of DFIs and commercial investors and senior debt financed from commercial sources. RIF II will invest in equity, quasi-equity (totaling 45 million) and senior loans (55 million) of microfinance institutions (MFIs), primarily in IDA and IDA blend countries, and have a rural focus. The funds manager, Incofin Investment Management (Incofin IM), a limited partnership, and the General Partner Incoteam- are known to IFC from IFCs earlier investment in RIF I- the first global microfinance investment vehicle targeting rural MFIs. RIF II, as in RIF I, has a double bottom-line approach to screening and assessing MFIs, putting equal emphasis on financial risk analysis and social/environmental risk analysis. Indeed, in addition to the usual financial criteria such as financial structure, risk management, strategy, market outlook, RIF II will emphasize outreach, environment and corporate social responsibility, human resources, and quality of customer services.

The project will promote the commercial viability of MFIs providing financial services to the rural poor, by providing an attractive return to investors, and strengthening rural MFIs financial structure and institutional capacity. The project will increase outreach in rural areas, achieve sustainability, thus impacting the lives or rural clients, representing three quarters of the worlds poor. It will demonstrate the commercial case for rural microfinance and encourage private investors in this sector, and expand rural finance globally. Finance for farmers and rural sector activities has been one of the most challenging areas of development finance. RIFs goal is to become the reference name in this domain.
